paper_abstract: In 1998 Luczak, Rodl and Szemeredi [7] proved, by means of the Regularity Lemma, that there exists no such that, for any n >= no and two-edge-colouring of K(n), there exists a pair of vertex-disjoint monochromatic cycles of opposite colours covering the vertices of K(n). In this paper we make use of an alternative method of finding useful structure in a graph, leading to a proof of the same result with a much smaller value of n(0). The proof gives a polynomial-time algorithm for finding the two cycles.
paper_title: Covering two-edge-coloured complete graphs with two disjoint monochromatic cycles
